Description: The Recon-ng Python Framework provides independent modules, database interaction, built in convenience functions, interactive help, and command completion. Recon-ng offers an environment in which open source web-based reconnaissance can be conducted quickly and thoroughly.

Socket.io is a NodeJS realtime framework server. Socket.IO is composed of two parts: a server that integrates with or mounts onto the NodeJS HTTP server and a client library that loads on the browser side. It allows you to
send and receive any events, with any data. It uses objects that can be encoded as JSON, as well as binary data.

The Sunrise Shop Framework Java Sample Code by Commercetools provides a live demo to demonstrate eCommerce implementation. By viewing the course with right click, developers will know how the framework was integrated into a clothing store.
The Betfair Cougar Java Framework by Betfair simplifies the development of network exposed service interfaces on Java platforms. The framework’s current version is 3.2.1.

The Squarespace CSS Dossier Framework by Squarespace is a template for grid-style blogs. The framework’s functional attributes include grid-style blog list page offering a variety of layout options and item header for fullscreen blog, among others. A Node Package Manager allows developers to initiate dependency management and run build scripts. The framework is a proprietary platform and developers are required to comply with the Squarespace TOS when using it.

Marley enables RESTful web services and applications. Marley consists of a simple Rack application, a default controller for ORM classes, a Sequel-based plugin system, reusable resource sets, and JSON data support. The current version is 0.8.3.
The BloodMagic Objective-C Framework by Railsware provides a platform for creating custom property attributes en building iOS applications.
The Javalin Java Framework serves the lightweight REST API. A getting started guide is available at https://javalin.io/documentation#getting-started
The Javalin Kotlin Framework serves the lightweight REST API. An example is available at https://javalin.io/tutorials/simple-kotlin-example

Fastify is a fast and low overhead web framework for NodeJS. The Fastify NodeJS Framework provides RESTful tools for interacting with the Fastify platform. It optimizes developer experience with minimum overhead and powerful plugin architecture.
The Zeit JavaScript NextJS Framework is designed for server-rendered React apps. Setup requires npm installation.

The Bulma CSS Framework by Jeremy Thomas is a CSS application development platform that is based on Flexbox. The framework’s documentation provides the installation paths for NPM, Yarn, or Bower. It supports the latest versions of Chrome, Firefox, Edge, Opera, and Safari browsers.
The Tailwind CSS Framework is a utility-first platform for rapid UI development.

The ZfrPusher PHP Zend Framework by Zfr is a module that is anchored on the ZfrPusher. The framework communicates with the Pusher HTTP API. Its deployment requires PHP 5.3, Zend Framework 2, and the ZfrPusher platform.

Alexia enables the creation of Amazon Echo skills using NodeJS. This framework handles Amazon Echo requests which are translated into intents for application processing. Alexia can control the flow of intents by using transitions. Localization is provided by i18next. The current version is 2.4.0.

ReSTbasis is a REST web development framework based on W3C standards, and MVC architectural patterns. ReSTbasis provides the blueprints that can produce high performing single page applications with integrated security. Software requirements include Java, NodeJS, npm or yarn, and Grunt. ReSTbasis offers a 90 day free trial version.
Ramaze offers a modular web application framework that features an MVC pattern out of the box. Ruby 1.8+ is required.

Volt offers a framework for building data rich web applications where Ruby code runs on both the server and the client. Volt features automated DOM updating, and URL page state storage. The current version is 0.9.7.
Pakyow offers a progressive platform for building web applications with several features such as auto-updating views, and rapid prototyping. The current version is 0.11.3.

Trailblazer is a business logic framework with an object-oriented architecture. Trailblazer is a thin layer on top of Rails that offers new high-level abstractions and enforces encapsulation. The current version is 2.0.7.

The Squarespace CSS Endeavor Framework by Squarespace features a hover-activated index gallery. Some of its functional features include index gallery and gallery-style navigation as well as overlay style introductions for pages or collections and SVG UI icons with weights. A Node Package Manager allows developers to initiate dependency management and run build scripts. The framework is a proprietary platform and developers re required to comply with the Squarespace TOS when using it.

The Squarespace CSS Doncab Framework by Squarespace provides unique gallery layouts for projects. It is functionally designed to provide “Full Width, Half Width, Alternating Width, and Grid layout options for Index Collections.” The framework also features page transition animations and AJAX loaede pages. A Node Package Manager allows developers to initiate dependency management and run build scripts. The framework is a proprietary platform and developers re required to comply with the Squarespace TOS when using it.

The Squarespace CSS Wright Framework by Squarespace is a multi-purpose template framework for Squarespace. Some of the framework’s functional attributes include parallax scrolling images and background video, flexible header and mobile bars featuring interchangeable and movable components, and SVG UI icons with adjustable weights, among others. A Node Package Manager allows developers to initiate dependency management and run build scripts. The framework is a proprietary platform and developers re required to comply with the Squarespace TOS when using it.

The Squarespace CSS Bureau Framework by Squarespace features grid-based, magazine-style blog. Some of the framework’s functional features include SVG UI icons with weights and blog with three different styles – that is, auto-columns, baseline, and top-aligned. It also provides a two-column overlay style navigation panel and related posts supports among other features. A Node Package Manager allows developers to initiate dependency management and run build scripts. The framework is a proprietary platform and developers are required to comply with the Squarespace TOS when using it.

The Atlassian Connect Spring Boot Java Framework by Atlassian allows developers to create Atlassian Connect Add-ons for JIRA. Some of the framework’s dependencies include Spring Framework, Spring Boot, Spring Data, and Spring Security.

The Atlassian Connect Express NodeJS Framework by Atlassian provides developers the tools for building Atlassian Connect-anchored Add-ons using the NodeJS language. These Add-ons facilitate the extension of Atlassian applications across standard web protocols and APIs.
The ofxNDI C++ Framework by Lynn Jarvis is an addon that facilitates the conveyance of images over a network using the NewTek Network Device Protocol.

The Phoenix Framework in Elixir language allows the creation of interactive experiences across browsers, native mobile apps, and embedded devices in real time. With the framework, developers can develop APIs and HTML 5 applications.
